451550f9-bc5e-499d-95e2-0e5b099f03cc.description: The earner of this badge has participated in an internship as defined by the National Association of Colleges & Employers (NACE): “An internship is a form of experiential learning that integrates knowledge and theory learned in the classroom with practical application and skills development in a professional setting. Internships give students the opportunity to gain valuable applied experience and make connections in professional fields they are considering for career paths”.
451550f9-bc5e-499d-95e2-0e5b099f03cc.name: CEDC Internship Program

badge_template_activities.title: Internship had a defined beginning and end based on a job description with desired qualifications, and acquired skills and knowledge are transferable to other employment settings. Experience encompassed supervision and routine feedback by a professional with expertise and educational and/or professional background in the field of the experience. Also, internship may have included remuneration, completed traditionally or remotely/virtually.

Gained relevant experience in the internship as an extension and application of classroom knowledge, including clearly defined learning objectives/goals related to the professional goals of academic coursework. In addition, resources, equipment, and facilities were provided by the host employer to support learning objectives/goals.

a13491a0-a292-4616-aa46-7b33ca4af53f.description: This recognition is bestowed upon Lehman College students who have met all of the qualifications for a Bachelor's degree. To earn a Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Fine Arts degree or a Bachelor of Business Administration, a student must be formally admitted to Lehman College. At a high level, the set of characteristics recommended for Lehman graduates can be summarized as Educated, Empowered and Engaged.
a13491a0-a292-4616-aa46-7b33ca4af53f.name: Bachelor of Arts Spring 2020

badge_template_activities.title: In order to qualify for graduation, undergraduate students must satisfy the following requirements for a Bachelor's Degree: 120 cumulative credits; 30 credits in “Overall Residency;” at least ½ the number of credits in the declared major for “Major Residency;” all “General Education” requirements completed; all “Major” requirements completed; 2.0 GPA in declared Major and 2.0 GPA in overall credits completed.

9d22e77f-75ac-4fec-a1f3-dae3ad8b95d2.description: Teaching and Learning with Technology badge is awarded to teacher candidates, cooperating/mentor teachers and faculty who demonstrate satisfactory skills in using technology in teaching and learning in PK-12 classrooms and/or higher education. School of Education in partnership with expert independent contractors who are former NYC DOE teachers offer educational technology workshops for Google Classroom, Microsoft Teams, etc. for all teacher candidates, cooperating/mentor teachers and faculty.
9d22e77f-75ac-4fec-a1f3-dae3ad8b95d2.name: School of Education – Teaching and Learning with Technology

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge teacher candidates, cooperating/mentor teachers and faculty must participate in Google Classroom/MS Teams Workshop Series (6 – 10 hours). Teacher candidates, cooperating/mentor teachers and faculty are also eligible for the badge if they share their use of various technology tools during presentations, office hours, etc.

973a21da-aa28-4f4b-b007-00d3b2f660a7.description: The Outstanding Junior Badge is awarded to juniors who are the top of their class and have achieved great academic feats in addition to actively participating in their campus community through service, leadership development, and student engagement.
973a21da-aa28-4f4b-b007-00d3b2f660a7.name: Lehman College CUNY - Fall 2021 Outstanding Junior

badge_template_activities.title: To receive this badge students must submit an application to be recognized as an Outstanding Junior and be selected amongst their peers.

4a3a40b2-d0fa-45ad-bb2d-bb5a8b1b54ee.description: The earner of this badge has participated in a series of four career development activities targeted to prepare freshman students with the necessary foundational skills to make them career competent sophomores while enhancing their career readiness skills. The earner is able to identify their existing and needed soft skills, compete for internships and jobs, and articulate their professional goals to help them begin their career journey.
4a3a40b2-d0fa-45ad-bb2d-bb5a8b1b54ee.name: The Career Ready Freshman Initiative

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in four CEDC-sponsored career development activities. Completion of the Focus 2 self-assessments, and Target Your Resume to the Career You Want, Mastering the Art of Interviewing, and Build the Skills Employers Need  Workshops.

Complete action tasks related to each workshop and assessment. The action tasks related to each workshop are engagement in a virtual mock interview, resume approval by a career advisor, and successful completion and review of the Focus 2 self-assessments and Am I Career Ready assessment with a career action plan.

5d129564-7e61-4375-933a-14e84b5576be.description: The earner of this badge has participated in a series of four workshops designed to enhance their career readiness skills. The earner is able to market themselves effectively to employers, compete for positions, and articulate their professional goals to help them launch their career.
5d129564-7e61-4375-933a-14e84b5576be.name: Career Exploration and Development

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in four CEDC-sponsored career development workshops. Workshop options include Dress for Success, LinkedIn 101, Target Your Resume to the Career You Want, The Ingredients of a Perfect Cover Letter, The Elevator Pitch and Mastering the Art of Interviewing.

Complete action tasks related to each workshop. The action tasks related to each workshop are a Dress for Success Vision Board, 100% completion of LinkedIn Profile, resume and cover letter approval by a career advisor, completed Elevator Pitch and engagement in role play and a Mock Interview.

fb4f4afd-fa95-408a-ae1a-c49a7e92e1b8.description: The PTS3 Winter Bootcamp Scholar Badge is awarded to a student who participates in the winter bootcamp in order to develop themselves as scholars and to apply for award opportunities that include internships, research, and global awards.
fb4f4afd-fa95-408a-ae1a-c49a7e92e1b8.name: Lehman College CUNY - PTS3 Winter Bootcamp Scholar

badge_template_activities.title: Awarded to a student who completed their participation in the PTS3 Winter Bootcamp hosting by the Office of Prestigious Awards.

d8f09cbd-8ee1-486c-a4f9-5ce47244cdcc.description: This badge is earned by students and alumni who have participated, competed or volunteered in the 2022 CUNY Virtual Hackathon. The event was facilitated by the CUNY Digital Currency Initiative, a Lehman College technology club. In collaboration with Queens College, Lehman College hosted this 72-hour event presenting challenges on topics such as blockchain, cryptocurrency, and NFTs. f9f535c7-60d5-4928-a558-26da5c5c008d.description: Funded by the City Council of New York, the Small Business Consulting Practice is designed to train participants to consult with small businesses and help them grow. The objective is to provide students knowledge on how to start a business and the explore the tools available to help grow a business. Students are then matched with small business owners in the community and local entrepreneurs.
f9f535c7-60d5-4928-a558-26da5c5c008d.name: Small Business Consulting Practice

badge_template_activities.title: In order to receive this credential, students must participate in 75 hours of training in Business Planning/Financial Projections, Business Presentation Pitch Decks, Social Media Marketing Strategy, and Website Design. Students must also work with at least one or more small business owners and assist them in one of these four areas.

bbc78ff2-54c3-4f72-9f47-ac71153767e1.description: After a short introduction on the history of virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR), workshop participants will be introduced to the Unity platform. Unity’s interface, asset store and customization features will be reviewed. Participants will be able to work on available computers or on their own devices. While Unity can be used for development on a wide array of platforms, emphasis will be placed on VR and AR projects to be built for the HTC Vive.
bbc78ff2-54c3-4f72-9f47-ac71153767e1.name: Introduction to the Unity Platform

badge_template_activities.title: Introduction to Unity: a. Breaking down and customizing the interface; b. Creating a new project; c. Folder structures; d. Scene navigation; e. Asset store and 3D assets; f. Introduction to the HTC Vive and demos. Session will introduce scenes and assets in Unity. Participants will be introduced to prefabs, materials, and other Unity concepts and structures that are essential to building applications.

Scene Building: a. Creating 3D Assets; b. Materials and Textures; c. Physics, Colliders and Rigid bodies; d. Prefabs; e. Scripting; b. Small projects. Session will introduce additional common features found in Unity and in most games and applications. After this introduction, participants will be able to experiment with these features as well as introduce small projects.

Enhancing applications: a. Lighting; b. Particle systems; c. Navigation; d. Sound; e. Continuation of small project. Final session will dive deeper into the Unity scripting API. Participants will continue working on their small projects and learn about animation within Unity. User interface will be covered and added to projects. Participants will also learn about deployment to target platforms.

1beb930d-577d-4df5-8930-02d5db8f4260.description: This designation is bestowed upon Lehman College students, faculty and staff who participate in the Human Library at Lehman College as a Human Book. 1beb930d-577d-4df5-8930-02d5db8f4260.name: Lehman College/CUNY - Leonard Lief Library - Human Library - Fall 2019

badge_template_activities.title:
To receive this badge a Human Book volunteers to:
Discuss their unique story on a challenging topic(s),
Answer difficult questions from readers who “check” them out,
Help shape a new understanding of people’s differences,
Honor diversity within the Lehman College community.
For more information please refer to the Human Library at Lehman College Guide.

d50ad3c7-d328-4a73-a4a0-542342487d3d.description: In completing the Innovation Academy Level 1, students have furthered their practice in the virtual and augmented reality technologies, agile methodologies as applied in developing interactive content, 3D modeling and animation techniques using 3D content creation software, conversions between various 3D formats, importing to real-time interactive content creation software, developing components and prototypes and related techniques.
d50ad3c7-d328-4a73-a4a0-542342487d3d.name: Certified AR/VR Developer, Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: A 10-month applied course of study in VR and AR technologies. Mobile application development, AR application development for mobile platforms, EON Mobile VR - application on mobile HMD, Programming the physics in real time rendering application, Advanced visual appearance features in real time rendering, Various CAD/DCC geometry conversions method for interactive 3D applications, Development of new modules as example of software development process.

2fd2a089-9e88-4b7e-95ad-6b4fdddf15c2.description: 78 instructional hours on immersive media. Composed of four modules, the course will focus on the Unity platform as the means to developing content for Augmented and Virtual Reality.
2fd2a089-9e88-4b7e-95ad-6b4fdddf15c2.name: Virtual Reality Training Academy - Unity - Phase 1

badge_template_activities.title: Phase 1: Module 1 - On-boarding and Introduction to XR (6 Hours). History of immersive technologies. Trends in hardware. Software. Market projections.
Module 2 - Introduction to Unity (24 hours). Getting around in Unity. Folder structure. Game Objects. Primitives and place holder. Game objects. Materials.
Module 3 - Intermediate Unity (24 hours). Snaps and grids Physics, colliders, triggers. User interface fundamentals Scripting Joints and hinges.
Module 4 - Project Management (24 hours). Introduction to Project Management. Methodologies – Agile, Waterfall, Kanban. Scrum – Project Management Methodology. Risk Management. Storyboards & Designs.

62103414-fb50-42c6-b611-51d708650987.description: The Blackstone LaunchPad network makes entrepreneurship and entrepreneurial skills accessible and relevant for all college founders to help them build thriving companies, small businesses, and careers.This signature program supports LaunchPad’s goal of de-risking entrepreneurship, broadening accessibility, and diversifying engagement with a focus on recruiting underrepresented and under-resourced students to participate.
62103414-fb50-42c6-b611-51d708650987.name: Blackstone LaunchPad: Ambassadors Cohort - Spring 2022

badge_template_activities.title: In order to receive the badge, participants are required to complete all “hybrid” tasks, workshops, assignments, and the Startup Tree and Talent LMS platform certifications. Attending weekly workshops, bi-weekly weekend workshops, and monthly industry panels is mandatory. Pitching your Startup Launch idea at the end of the Blackstone LaunchPad is required to complete the program.

843e0121-bf18-4b72-8c09-b24f639ef4fc.description: This designation serves as a testament of completion of the Bloomberg Market Concepts (BMC) e-learning course on the Bloomberg Terminal. 2c5aafef-d314-4489-ab6a-67a0cbe3fb37.description: The recipient of this badge has completed the Public Interest Technology Data Science Corps (PIT-DSC) program. Funded by the New America Foundation, the PIT-DSC is a collaboration between Columbia University and Lehman College. Program participants work together in teams on data science projects focused on improving underserved communities in New York City. The program includes a bootcamp that provides students with technical and soft skills needed to work effectively in data science teams.
2c5aafef-d314-4489-ab6a-67a0cbe3fb37.name: Public Interest Technology Data Science Corps Program Summer 2021 - Mentors

badge_template_activities.title: To receive this credential, students must participate in the bootcamp and the 8-week summer internship. At the end of the program, students will summarize their results in a report provided to the project owner.

f59266de-4eda-4057-98d7-816a6c656774.description: After completion of the Introduction to the Unity, workshop participants will expand the Unity know-how with this Intermediate level course, which will focus on lighting, audio, physics, particle systems and basic animation. Discussions and demonstrations on how this impacts game play and the mood of any application will be shown. Useful assets, both free and paid, from the Asset Store will be highlighted.
f59266de-4eda-4057-98d7-816a6c656774.name: Unity Intermediate

alignments.name: Unity curriculum
alignments.description: The Unity online or in-person courses comes with step-by-step professional instruction and hands-on projects. We’ve partnered with the best learning platforms and trainers to create Unity authorized courses.

badge_template_activities.title: Introduction to the Unity Platform

e5131700-9596-4f74-8d42-4496fefa69d3.description: 102 instructional hours on immersive media. Composed of eight modules, the course will focus on the Unity platform as the means to developing content for Augmented and Virtual Reality.
e5131700-9596-4f74-8d42-4496fefa69d3.name: Virtual Reality Training Academy - Unity - Phase 2

badge_template_activities.title: Phase 2: Module 5 - 3D Modeling with Blender (24 hours). Introduction to Blender UI. Introduction to Mesh Modeling Techniques. Materials and UV Unwrapping. Introduction to Photoshop and Custom Texture Maps. Specular and Normal Maps. Lighting Advanced Texturing and Composition.

Module 6 – Programming in C# (24 hours). Creating a C# script in Unity. Using directive. Methods in C#. Data types. Monobehaviour – the Start and Update methods. Loops in C#. Serialization – exposing variables in the editor. Coroutines. Persistence through Scriptable Objects. Communicating between classes.

Module 7–Capstone Project (54 hours). Develop an XR application from concept to implementation. During this module student will ideate an XR application, generate design documents and come up with a plan to successfully complete the application. Using scrum methodology student will work with a team over a period of 5-6 weeks to develop the project.

80edb1de-6b70-4f21-aa50-ec67cca32fba.description: The recipient of this badge thoroughly understands that cryptocurrencies differ from fiat (government-issued) forms of money and how crypto such as stablecoins and central bank digital currencies, are different from bitcoin. Recipients can communicate where emerging cryptocurrency applications fit into the regulatory marketplace for financial professionals, specifically the impact on payments and banking.
80edb1de-6b70-4f21-aa50-ec67cca32fba.name: Cryptocurrency + Blockchain - Upskilling

badge_template_activities.title: Students, alums, and the Lehman community earn this badge who complete Intro to Cryptocurrency (ACC 186) and Intro to Blockchain (ACC 187).

skills.name: Ability to articulate specifics of different blockchain applications
Assume leadership roles around blockchain and crypto projects
Differentiate and explain different blockchain use cases
Lead conversations with colleagues around cryptocurrency implementation
Technical analysis of bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete no fewer than 30 credits of graduate courses that are acceptable to the department of specialization.  Maintain a minimum Grade Point Average of 3.0.  In most programs, write a thesis based on independent research, complete an appropriate special project, and/or pass a comprehensive examination. Complete all requirements for the degree within five years following matriculation.  Complete all departmental requirements for the degree.

cf020c6b-e139-41c0-a423-daaa1fedf6a7.description: The Most Engaged Badge is awarded to a student scholar who is actively engaged at Lehman College and has worked with the Office of Prestigious Awards by attending workshops, events, and fellowship advising sessions. The student has actively grasped opportunities and resources to develop their academic and professional goals.
cf020c6b-e139-41c0-a423-daaa1fedf6a7.name: Lehman College CUNY - Most Engaged Spring 2021

badge_template_activities.title: The Most Engaged Badge is awarded to a student scholar who has attended the most number of workshops, events, and fellowship advising sessions with the Office of Prestigious Awards than any other student.
